title-group.article-title: AN IMPROVED LOWER BOUND FOR THE DE BRUIJN-NEWMAN CONSTANT

abstract.p: In this article, we report on computations that led to the discovery of a new Lehmer pair of zeros for the Riemann ζ function. Given this new close pair of zeros, we improve the known lower bound for de Bruijn-Newman constant Λ. The Riemann hypothesis is equivalent to the assertion Λ ≤ 0. In this article, we establish that in fact we have Λ > -1.14541 × 10 -11 . This new bound confirms the belief that if the Riemann hypothesis is true, it is barely true.
